data.title: Olu Jacobs, Omotola, RMD... Nigerian celebrity marriages that have lasted two decades
data.meta_description: It is often believed that celebrity marriages do not last. TheCable looks at some in Nigeria that have beaten the odds to span over 20 years.
data.text:
Celebrity marriages can fail due to intense public scrutiny fueled by a highly engaged media audience, the demanding careers of the couple, and the volume of time spent apart due to work commitments.

Advertisement

The stakes are almost always high, with vested interests putting a strain on the relationship.

Fame can lead to a lack of privacy while the pressures of maintaining a public image create unrealistic expectations.

The hedonistic tendencies of famed individuals can contribute to infidelity and make it difficult to sustain a marriage in the spotlight.

Advertisement

In Nigeria, traditional expectations and family pressures often conflict with the western modernity that celebrities embrace.

Issues such as polygamy, financial disparities, and extended family obligations can complicate relationships.

This makes it difficult for some celebrity marriages to thrive while others come crashing in no time

Advertisement

TheCable looks at some celebrity marriages in Nigeria that have beaten the odds to last over twenty years.

Olu Jacobs and Joke Silva

This celebrity couple has set the standard for many marriages as they have been married for 35 years.

It is believed that the couple met in 1981 at the National Theatre in Lagos.

This is a period that coincided with Nigeria’s 21st independence anniversary.

Advertisement

They would tie the knot eight years later in 1989 and have two children.

Jacobs and Silva founded and co-operated the Lufodo Group, a media corporation that consists of film production, distribution assets, and an academy of performing arts.

In November 2021, Silva disclosed that Jacobs was battling dementia.

Pictures showed her husband had lost weight.

Advertisement

Silva, in an interview, would open up on his deteriorating health and her struggles taking care of him.

Through the thick and thin, however, their bond remains strong.

Tunde and Wunmi Obe

They are fondly called T.W.O. and got married in 1998.

The Nigerian show business, music, and entrepreneurs couple met as undergraduates at the university.

Advertisement

Tunde and Wumi burst into the entertainment scene with their regular appearances on The Charly Boy show.

They gained massive traction after the release of ‘Sealed’, their debut studio album, in 1999.

Having been married for 26 years, the couple have had three children.

RMD and Jumobi Adegbesan

Richard Mofe-Damijo tied the knot with his partner Jumobi on December 20, 2000.

This was after May Ellen-Ezekiel, the actor’s first wife, passed away in 1996.

RMD and Jumobi have had four children together.

Since she tied the knot with RMD, Jumobi, a popular TV presenter, has been absent from the media.

In September 2023, RMD revealed why actors struggle to remain faithful in marriage.

“It is hard to be faithful in marriage because of the line of work we are in,” he said.

“Every one of us that is married, we are the target. Look at how women are. How can you escape it?”

Omotola Jalade- Ekeinde and Matthew Ekeinde

When Omotola and Matthew tied the knot in 1996, brows were raised and heads turned because the actress was 18.

Now 28 years later, their union is still waxing strong and has produced four children: Princess, M.J., Meraiah, and Michael.

Their marriage was tested in 2021 when rumours started circulating that Omotola was having an affair with Adams Oshiomhole, the politician.

The actress however denied the claims and challenged those who insinuated the affair to provide proof for their allegations.

Gloria and Nobert Young

Gloria and Nobert‘s marriage is proof that celebrity marriages can work.

The couple, notable for their roles in different movies, has been married since 2002 and has three children.

In an interview with TheCable, Norbert opened up about his views on infidelity as an actor.

“If you are not disciplined, you will fall easily into temptations,” he said.

“There is temptation everywhere but your commitment to your job, marriage, and partner will help you to see it through.

“You will be exposed to a lot of people in your everyday life.

“If you are committed to your relationship, you will know how to handle yourself.”

Omoni and Nnamdi Oboli

The 10-year age difference between the couple has not stopped their love from blossoming.

Their marriage is among those that have stood the test of time.

Omoni and Nnamdi walked down the aisle on October 28, 2000.

They remain married almost 24 years later.

The union has been blessed with three children namely Gozi, Chizi, and Tobe.

The couple have also co-produced several hit movies together.

They include ‘Being Mrs Elliott’ and ‘Render to Ceasar’.

Tony and Ogo Umez

The ace Nollywood actor and his wife have been married since 1999 and have four children together.

It is believed that the couple met on the set of a movie.

They recently celebrated their 24th wedding anniversary while showering econium on each other and expressing their unwavering love for each other.

Peju Ogunmola and Sunday Omobolanle (Papi Luwe)

The marriage between the two prominent Yoruba actors in 1989 caused quite a stir.

This was because Luwe was already married with three children and Peju was just 23 at the time.

However, the celebrity couple remained married 35 years later.

Tope and Soji Alabi

Soji and Tope tied the knot in 2000 and have remained steadfast in their love for each other.

Almost 24 years later, the couple have remained married and Soji also doubles as his wife’s manager and music producer.

He is the also chief executive of Gospel Vibes Limited, the management to which his wife is signed.

Francis and Adokiye Duru

Ace actor Francis Duru walked down the aisle with Adokiye, his wife, on May 31, 2003.

The couple met as undergraduates at the University of Port-Harcourt, Rivers state.

After 21 years, their union is still strong. They have four children.
